definition: (of dreams, hopes etc) to vanish/to evaporate/(of a person) to become disillusioned/disillusionment
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: The hybrid child of a murderous utopia and a disenchanted époque.
sentences.chinese: 血腥凶残的乌托邦和幻灭的时代产下了混血儿。

sentences.english: A Dream of Red Mansions is a tragedy evanescence of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 所以说《红楼梦》是一部美的幻灭的悲剧。

sentences.english: In the early decades of the 20th century disillusionment and pessimism prevailed in the post-war Europe.
sentences.chinese: 二十世纪早期，悲观主义和幻灭感弥漫着战后的欧洲。
是“理想幻灭的低谷”，麦当劳先生如是说。

sentences.english: Now some fear that the "3D bubble" has already burst.
sentences.chinese: 现在对于“3D泡沫”的恐惧几乎已经幻灭。

sentences.english: They also experience disillusionment and heartache, causing them to fall back.
sentences.chinese: 他们也会经历理想的幻灭和心碎，这会让他们退缩。

sentences.english: The major result has been a massive disinvestment in state structures.
sentences.chinese: 主要后果是对国家结构的广泛幻灭。
她的梦想不久就幻灭了。

sentences.english: Would an economic downturn quickly send head-counts plunging again?
sentences.chinese: 一次经济低迷会不会很快让人丁兴旺之景再度幻灭？

sentences.english: Therefore, the strong feelings that human civilization is doomed to be destroyed permeate her works.
sentences.chinese: 故而，她的作品带着浓重的对整个人类文明的幻灭感。

sentences.english: Disillusionment with the political class is a more powerful factor that will keep people away from the polls.
sentences.chinese: 对政治阶级的幻灭感是人们不再投票的更重要的原因。

sentences.english: His loneliness and disillusion had been a cause of the incident in the hotel .
sentences.chinese: 他的孤独和幻灭感是这次在饭店里出事的一个原因。

sentences.english: This is extremely unlikely to happen, and therefore disillusionment will set in very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是相当不可能发生的，所以希望将很快幻灭。

definition: to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
